KH.content: double exclusion (neither this nor that), participation (both this & that), can we transport this logic, para-logic from one set to another
KH.linkedContent: double exclusion (neither this nor that), participation (both this & that), can we transport this logic, para-logic from one set to another

KH.content: displacement from type of existent thing to type of discourse via metonymy (sensible/intelligible > mythos/logos)
KH.linkedContent: displacement from type of existent thing to type of discourse via metonymy (sensible/intelligible > mythos/logos)

KH.content: speculative dialectics inscribes mythic thought in a teleological perspective

KH.content: philosophy becomes serious when it awakes from its mythological slumber
KH.linkedContent: philosophy becomes serious when it awakes from its mythological slumber

KH.content: silhouette of a “logic,” impossible to formalize, is this “bastard” logos [outside logic of noncontradiction] mythos? [re: khōra]

KH.content: mytheme, acc. Hegel, will have been a prephilosopheme promised to a dialectical Aufhebung

KH.content: acc. Hegel, Plato uses myth because he’s impotent, a ludico-mythological drift (dérive), Aristotle Hegel’s guarantor of seriousness
KH.linkedContent: acc. Hegel, Plato uses myth because he’s impotent, a ludico-mythological drift (dérive), Aristotle Hegel’s guarantor of seriousness

KH.content: even if Plato is a master for using myth, myth remains subordinate to philosophical theme

KH.content: Aristotle: “those who philosophize w/ recourse to myth are not worth treating seriously”

KH.content: acc. Hegel, nothing serious, only mythology in introductions

KH.content: Plato’s play of the probable myth (ton eikota mython), take pleasure w/out remorse, getts ahead of Aristotle (on seriousness), and turns myth into rigor (seriousness of play)

KH.content: myth an image of the image of sensory becoming

KH.content: khōra as myth w/in myth, inscribed for a moment, while having a bearing on the place of inscription, oneiric, bastard reading, heterogenous to philosopho-mytheme which orders myth to its philosophical telos

KH.content: in Timaeus, Greeks who have no writing (unlike Egyptians), need myth (destined to perpetual childhood) > memory of city, its salvation, entrusted to the writing of the other [who is the master here?]
KH.linkedContent: in Timaeus, Greeks who have no writing (unlike Egyptians), need myth (destined to perpetual childhood) > memory of city, its salvation, entrusted to the writing of the other [who is the master here?]

KH.content: one telling to the next, author gets farther & farther away: mythic saying resembles a discourse w/out a legitimate father, orphan, bastard, distinguished from philosophy, in Phaedrus, which must have a father to answer for it
KH.linkedContent: one telling to the next, author gets farther & farther away: mythic saying resembles a discourse w/out a legitimate father, orphan, bastard, distinguished from philosophy, in Phaedrus, which must have a father to answer for it

FL.content: Benjamin grafted language of Marxist revolution onto messianism [see p. 263]: both announcing new historical epoch & beginning of a true history void of myth
FL.linkedContent: Benjamin grafted language of Marxist revolution onto messianism [see p. 263]: both announcing new historical epoch & beginning of a true history void of myth

BL.content: quasi-event of the murder of father, event w/out event, resembles fiction, myth, fable > real, effective guilt; question of belief & historical referent—irremediably fissured
BL.linkedContent: quasi-event of the murder of father, event w/out event, resembles fiction, myth, fable > real, effective guilt; question of belief & historical referent—irremediably fissured

BL.content: dead father more powerful than living one

SPOM.content: there’s no nationalism, nationality, that’s not religious or mythological
SPOM.linkedContent: there’s no nationalism, nationality, that’s not religious or mythological

PP.content: Socrates give[s] myths a send off (envoyer promener les mythes), les saluer, dismisses them, cette belle résolution du khairein [Phaedrus (230a) Socrates says goodbye to myths, because he does not even know himself], khairein in name of truth, self-knowledge, autoscopy, autognosis

PP.content: Derrida treats this send off, in a dialogue w/ 2 rigorously original myths [cicada, Theuth], as a welcoming of myths > both myths invented after question of writing
PP.linkedContent: Derrida treats this send off, in a dialogue w/ 2 rigorously original myths [cicada, Theuth], as a welcoming of myths > both myths invented after question of writing

PP.content: writing linked to myth, both contra knowledge (sought w/in oneself)

PP.content: writing as repeating w/out knowing (through a myth [?])

PP.content: organization of Theuth myth conforms to powerful constraints of “Greek language” and beyond

PP.content: the Platonic traits, mythological figures re: origin of writing > opens relation btwn mythemes & philosophemes in western logos: a history, or History, constituted by philosophical difference btwn mythos and logos

VP.content: if punctuality of instant is a myth, a spatial or mechanical metaphor, an inherited metaphysical concept, if presence of presence isn’t simple, all of Husserl’s logic is threatened

FSW.content: differance as non-originary origin, erases myth of origin, determined outside teleological/eschatological horizon [horizon key word here]
FSW.linkedContent: differance as non-originary origin, erases myth of origin, determined outside teleological/eschatological horizon [horizon key word here]

PPHS.content: origin, inaugural imaginary limit, myth of transcendental signified, archeology before trace and difference
PPHS.linkedContent: origin, inaugural imaginary limit, myth of transcendental signified, archeology before trace and difference

F.content: no-place proper to “original” event, “hypothetical zero hour,” creates cryptomythical system ——mythic founding event is only possible in secrecy—so it can ‘take place’
F.linkedContent: no-place proper to “original” event, “hypothetical zero hour,” creates cryptomythical system ——mythic founding event is only possible in secrecy—so it can ‘take place’

WM.content: white mythology [vis-à-vis Anatole France]: metaphysics, culture of West, erased w/in itself fabulous scene that produced it, this scene remains active—inscribed in white ink; white man takes his own mythology, his own logos, the mythos of his idiom, for universal Reason
WM.linkedContent: white mythology [vis-à-vis Anatole France]: metaphysics, culture of West, erased w/in itself fabulous scene that produced it, this scene remains active—inscribed in white ink; white man takes his own mythology, his own logos, the mythos of his idiom, for universal Reason

POS.content: Derrida never identified writing w/ myth, what interested him was how philosophy excluded writing to keep myth exterior to scientific rationality > deconstruction attempts to break up opposition btwn logos and mythos
POS.linkedContent: Derrida never identified writing w/ myth, what interested him was how philosophy excluded writing to keep myth exterior to scientific rationality > deconstruction attempts to break up opposition btwn logos and mythos

ATIA.content: Lacan designates castration complex as Freud’s scientific (nonmythological) original sin (being subjected to the signifier, a nonmastery that gives human mastery over animals)
ATIA.linkedContent: Lacan designates castration complex as Freud’s scientific (nonmythological) original sin (being subjected to the signifier, a nonmastery that gives human mastery over animals)

PF.content: quotations, suspend word [“United States”] in epokhē of epoch, a fabulous act of nomination, fabula (like provocation) recounts/deciphers a history, the phantasm of an accredited myth, myth by force of law, “enforced” myth
PF.linkedContent: quotations, suspend word [“United States”] in epokhē of epoch, a fabulous act of nomination, fabula (like provocation) recounts/deciphers a history, the phantasm of an accredited myth, myth by force of law, “enforced” myth

D.content: “primitive” mythical unity always reconstituted retrospectively dans l’après-coupure > the decision, le coup (shot, throw, blow) parts the seed as it projects it (partage la semence en la projetant)

LI.linkedContent: as though an auxiliary/parasite could not supplant, as if “parasite” is a simple addition

LI.content: inner purity & exterior supplement—this is myth itself (mythology of a logos)
LI.linkedContent: inner purity & exterior supplement—this is myth itself (mythology of a logos)

OG.content: deconstruction does not make writing innocent but shows why this violence does not befall (survient) an innocent language: violence is originary > wherever there’s the sense of a right side: mythological effect of return (retour)
OG.linkedContent: deconstruction does not make writing innocent but shows why this violence does not befall (survient) an innocent language: violence is originary > wherever there’s the sense of a right side: mythological effect of return (retour)

OG.linkedContent: no law w/out possibility of trace, what is lost in thought of trace (complicity of origins, arche-writing) is the myth of the simplicity of origin

OG.content: proper name has always been original myth of transparent legibility present under obliteration

OG.content: origin/nature as myth of addition, supplementarity annulled by being purely additive > myth of the effacement of the trace

OG.content: Lévi-Strauss: proper names are a quanta of signification below which all people do is point > this zero degree of language, pointing, “sensible-certitude”: a myth effaced by play of difference
OG.linkedContent: Lévi-Strauss: proper names are a quanta of signification below which all people do is point > this zero degree of language, pointing, “sensible-certitude”: a myth effaced by play of difference

OG.content: Rousseau tries to describe a language not yet corrupted by articulation, supplementarity, convention > time of that language: mythic limit btwn déjà and pas-encore
